title: NixOS Package PRs for elisa, zstd-1.5.5, power-profiles-daemon, git-2.40.1, git, plasma-disks-5.27.5 packages
description: NixOS Package PRs for elisa, zstd-1.5.5, power-profiles-daemon, git-2.40.1, git, plasma-disks-5.27.5 packages on GitHub

items.content_html:
Description of changes

commit 9998f40bb36ba6fc3b8252cfd7a3ea494b146056 (HEAD -> pic/ppd020, fork/pic/ppd020, master)
Date:   Sun Feb 18 13:46:56 2024 +0100

    nixosTests.power-profiles-daemon: test profilectl CLI
    
    We also take advantage of that change to point to the new dbus
    canonical names.

commit cc557e1055de6e913e1aa0aa312001d206b864c5
Date:   Sun Feb 18 13:43:46 2024 +0100

    power-profiles-daemon: 0.13 -> 0.20
    
    The upstream original maintainer is not paid anymore to maintain the
    project and decided to step down. The project has been taken over by
    the upower team.
    
    This is the first release part of this upower team.
    
    The integration tests are now relying on the powerprofilectl command:
    we need to patch the python path of this dependency before running the
    integration tests instead of doing that during in the fixup phase.
    
    Taking advantage of this to remove the PostFixup phase. Not 100% about
    this move: it's a bit less future proof.

Either download from Cachix:

nix-store -r /nix/store/1nry6k5yn522ycgxsavvnm5817rq1v8i-zstd-1.5.5-kernel-bin \

(The Cachix cache is only trusted for this store-path realization.)
For the Cachix download to work, your user must be in the trusted-users list or you can use sudo since root is effectively trusted.

Or, build yourself:

nix-build -A zstd https://github.com/r-ryantm/nixpkgs/archive/a5a51eebbfb24f238724fe3964f64f99f7fc4af1.tar.gz

Or:

nix build github:r-ryantm/nixpkgs/a5a51eebbfb24f238724fe3964f64f99f7fc4af1#zstd

After you've downloaded or built it, look at the files and if there are any, run the binaries:

items.title: git-filter-repo: fix broken --help option

items.content_html:
Description of changes

This PR replaces the recursive fetch of the package source by non-recursive fetches of the corresponding (sub-)modules. This allows to fully take advantage of the more efficient specialized fetchers, is more robust in presence of network issues, and allows for reusing sub-modules if they don't change between updates. Furthermore, it can be a starting point for reducing code duplication caused by the sub-modules (e.g. 4 times googletest, 3 times abseil or 2 times protobuf - not even counting the possibility of just using available nixpkgs packages instead of some of the submodules).

Things done

items.title: rustPlatform.importCargoLock: allow duplicated packages with git.

items.content_html:
Description of changes

We used to build calibre using its official tarball. However, the tarball contains lots of generated code such as javascript generated from python, python generated from pyqt... It also contained generated man pages.

The main difficulty to build calibre from git source is that it downloads six packages from internet, some of them is irreproducible. This commit patches that code in the following principles:

  1. The fewer changed the better.
  2. If a downloaded package is not pinned to a rev, pin it to a latest rev.
  3. If a downloaded package can't be pinned to a rev (such as downloading from https://code.calibre-ebook.com/ua-popularity), store it in nixpkgs.
  4. Allow passing downloaded packages using environment variable so user can override them when needed

Things done

  • Built on platform(s)
    • x86_64-linux
    • aarch64-linux
    • x86_64-darwin
    • aarch64-darwin

    • made sure NixOS tests are linked to the relevant packages

items.title: git-ignore: 1.2.2 -> 1.3.1

items.content_html:
There are no maintainers for this as shown by it still being at llvm 15 and it's unnecessary work to apply all changes to it.

It has not been a git version for a long time and often lags behind the latest stable llvm

Here are all the differences between the current base(15) of _git and 15 https://gist.github.com/Artturin/c39265ecaeea523cd7224fc7b7632371

We should do this because it eases (my) work on deduplicating llvmPackages, after more of it is deduplicated then we could reconsider adding this back but for now it's just a burden.

Any user who wants to use a git release can use the gitRelease argument in 13+

items.title: git-machete: 3.22.0 -> 3.23.1

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Latest git-lfs includes a patch that fixes builtins.fetchGit for lfs-enabled repos.
I think that patch is especially useful for nix users. git-lfs, being a mature project, releases fairly slowly, so I'd like to point nixpkgs at tip of git-lfs main for the time being.

Things done

Bumped git-lfs from v3.4.1 to cd04b35

items.title: python311Packages.torch: unroll recursive git retrieval

items.content_html:
Motivation for this change

This is required for doing anything with git-cvsimport. I thought
about adding a cvsSupport option like for Subversion, but it only adds
0.1MB to the closure size, and is only added when perl support is
enabled anyway, so it's not worth it.

Things done
  • Tested using sandboxing (nix.useSandbox on NixOS, or option sandbox in nix.conf on non-NixOS linux)
  • Built on platform(s)
    • NixOS
    • macOS
    • other Linux distributions
  • Tested via one or more NixOS test(s) if existing and applicable for the change (look inside nixos/tests)
  • Tested compilation of all pkgs that depend on this change using nix-shell -p nixpkgs-review --run "nixpkgs-review wip"

items.title: [Backport release-23.11] python310Packages.hg-git: 1.0.2 -> 1.0.3

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Along with #243458 this fixes #245849

The basic premise is that a git dep with install scripts that doesn't actually have any dev dependencies does sorta work with forceGitDeps = true, but it does not right now due to our own logic not failing gracefully in that case

I found pruning also needs to be turned off for this case, but I wasn't exactly sure why pruning specifically was requiring the cache to be available (edit: would be sorta fixed by #267314)

Things done

  • Built on platform(s)

items.content_html:
Automatic update generated by nixpkgs-update tools. This update was made based on information from passthru.updateScript.

meta.description for python311Packages.mkdocs-git-revision-date-localized-plugin is: MkDocs plugin that enables displaying the date of the last git modification of a page

meta.homepage for python311Packages.mkdocs-git-revision-date-localized-plugin is: https://github.com/timvink/mkdocs-git-revision-date-localized-plugin

meta.changelog for python311Packages.mkdocs-git-revision-date-localized-plugin is: https://github.com/timvink/mkdocs-git-revision-date-localized-plugin/releases/tag/v1.2.4

Updates performed
  • Ran passthru.UpdateScript
To inspect upstream changes
Impact

Checks done

  • built on NixOS
  • zed result is not automatically checked because some binaries stick around
Rebuild report (if merged into master) (click to expand) 
1 total rebuild path(s)

1 package rebuild(s)

First fifty rebuilds by attrpath
python311Packages.mkdocs-git-revision-date-localized-plugin
Instructions to test this update (click to expand)

Either download from Cachix:

nix-store -r /nix/store/qwvn9igxfnj01zlg7sps623xgc7r16g8-python3.11-mkdocs-git-revision-date-localized-plugin-1.2.4 \
  --option binary-caches 'https://cache.nixos.org/ https://nix-community.cachix.org/' \
  --option trusted-public-keys '
  nix-community.cachix.org-1:mB9FSh9qf2dCimDSUo8Zy7bkq5CX+/rkCWyvRCYg3Fs=
  cache.nixos.org-1:6NCHdD59X431o0gWypbMrAURkbJ16ZPMQFGspcDShjY=
  '

(The Cachix cache is only trusted for this store-path realization.)
For the Cachix download to work, your user must be in the trusted-users list or you can use sudo since root is effectively trusted.

Or, build yourself:

nix-build -A python311Packages.mkdocs-git-revision-date-localized-plugin https://github.com/r-ryantm/nixpkgs/archive/676219fcd2172b83a87bcd05ca54e55b1000cf17.tar.gz

Or:

nix build github:r-ryantm/nixpkgs/676219fcd2172b83a87bcd05ca54e55b1000cf17#python311Packages.mkdocs-git-revision-date-localized-plugin

After you've downloaded or built it, look at the files and if there are any, run the binaries:

ls -la /nix/store/qwvn9igxfnj01zlg7sps623xgc7r16g8-python3.11-mkdocs-git-revision-date-localized-plugin-1.2.4
ls -la /nix/store/qwvn9igxfnj01zlg7sps623xgc7r16g8-python3.11-mkdocs-git-revision-date-localized-plugin-1.2.4/bin

this change.

Note sometimes packages show up as failed to build independent of the
change, simply because they are already broken on the target branch.
